name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl is a trimesic acid derivative with three benzene rings connected linearly. The melting point of benzene is 5.5°C. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion would notably augment the melting point.
